curriculum.subject: History of French Settlement in Canada
curriculum.description: A comprehensive study of French colonization, settlement patterns, cultural development, and eventual transition of French territories in Canada from the early 1600s through British conquest and beyond.

clusters.name: Pre-Colonial Context and Early Exploration
clusters.description: The background conditions and initial French exploration that led to permanent settlement attempts in Canada.

topics.name: European Context and Motivations for Colonization
topics.description: The political, economic, and religious factors driving French overseas expansion in the 16th-17th centuries.

topics.name: Early French Explorers and Voyages
topics.description: Jacques Cartier, Samuel de Champlain, and other early explorers who mapped and claimed French territories in North America.
prerequisites: European Context and Motivations for Colonization

topics.name: Indigenous Peoples Before European Contact
topics.description: The diverse Native American societies, cultures, and territories that existed in Canada before French colonization.

clusters.name: Establishment of New France
clusters.description: The founding and early development of French colonial settlements and administrative structures in Canada.

topics.name: Founding of Quebec and Early Settlements
topics.description: The establishment of Quebec City (1608) and other early French settlements along the St. Lawrence River.
prerequisites: Early French Explorers and Voyages

topics.name: Colonial Government and Administration
topics.description: The development of French colonial administrative systems, royal government, and governance structures in New France.
prerequisites: Founding of Quebec and Early Settlements

topics.name: The Fur Trade and Economic Foundations
topics.description: The central role of fur trading in French colonial economy and its impact on settlement patterns and Indigenous relations.
prerequisites: Founding of Quebec and Early Settlements
Indigenous Peoples Before European Contact

clusters.name: Colonial Society and Culture
clusters.description: The development of distinctive French-Canadian society, culture, and institutions in New France.

topics.name: Seigneurial System and Land Distribution
topics.description: The feudal-style land tenure system used to organize rural settlement and society in New France.
prerequisites: Colonial Government and Administration

topics.name: French Immigration and Population Growth
topics.description: Patterns of French immigration to Canada, including the filles du roi and demographic development of the colony.
prerequisites: Founding of Quebec and Early Settlements

topics.name: Catholic Church and Religious Life
topics.description: The central role of Catholicism in French colonial society, missions to Indigenous peoples, and religious institutions.
prerequisites: French Immigration and Population Growth

topics.name: French-Indigenous Relations and Intermarriage
topics.description: The complex relationships between French colonists and Indigenous peoples, including alliances, conflicts, and cultural mixing.
prerequisites: The Fur Trade and Economic Foundations
Indigenous Peoples Before European Contact

clusters.name: Expansion and Territorial Development
clusters.description: The geographic spread of French influence and settlement across North America beyond the St. Lawrence Valley.

topics.name: Exploration of the Great Lakes and Interior
topics.description: French exploration and establishment of trading posts throughout the Great Lakes region and interior waterways.
prerequisites: The Fur Trade and Economic Foundations
French-Indigenous Relations and Intermarriage

topics.name: Louisiana Territory and Mississippi Valley
topics.description: French exploration and settlement of the Mississippi River system and establishment of Louisiana colony.
prerequisites: Exploration of the Great Lakes and Interior

topics.name: Acadia and Maritime Settlements
topics.description: The development of French settlements in Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, and surrounding maritime regions.
prerequisites: Founding of Quebec and Early Settlements

clusters.name: Imperial Conflicts and Competition
clusters.description: The military and political struggles between French and British colonial powers that shaped the fate of New France.

topics.name: King William's War and Early Anglo-French Conflicts
topics.description: The first major conflicts between French and British colonial forces in North America (1689-1697).
prerequisites: Colonial Government and Administration
Acadia and Maritime Settlements

topics.name: Queen Anne's War and Treaty of Utrecht
topics.description: The War of Spanish Succession in North America and the 1713 treaty that transferred Acadia to Britain.
prerequisites: King William's War and Early Anglo-French Conflicts

topics.name: King George's War and Fortress Louisbourg
topics.description: The strategic importance of Louisbourg and conflicts over control of maritime approaches to New France.
prerequisites: Queen Anne's War and Treaty of Utrecht

topics.name: Seven Years' War and the Plains of Abraham
topics.description: The decisive conflict that ended French rule in Canada, including key battles and military campaigns.
prerequisites: King George's War and Fortress Louisbourg

clusters.name: End of French Rule and Legacy
clusters.description: The transition from French to British rule and the lasting impact of French colonization on Canadian development.

topics.name: British Conquest and Treaty of Paris
topics.description: The formal transfer of New France to British control in 1763 and its immediate consequences.
prerequisites: Seven Years' War and the Plains of Abraham

topics.name: Deportation of the Acadians
topics.description: The forced removal of French Acadians from Maritime provinces and its long-term consequences.
prerequisites: Queen Anne's War and Treaty of Utrecht
British Conquest and Treaty of Paris

topics.name: French-Canadian Society Under British Rule
topics.description: How French-Canadian culture, language, and institutions adapted and persisted under British administration.
prerequisites: British Conquest and Treaty of Paris

topics.name: Legacy of French Settlement in Modern Canada
topics.description: The lasting impact of French colonization on Canadian geography, culture, language, and identity.
prerequisites: French-Canadian Society Under British Rule
Deportation of the Acadians
